comments.raw_text:
`runjunit.py` supports multiple test filters [in theory](https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/ea7f70dac1c5fd18400f6d2a92679777d4b21492/testing/mochitest/runjunit.py#162), however when the tests actually run, only the final test specified in the list of filters is executed.

According to the [`am instrument` documentation](https://developer.android.com/reference/androidx/test/runner/AndroidJUnitRunner#typical-usage), `-e class` may be used to run a single test.

OTOH, it looks to me like the way to get multiple filters to work is to push a text file to the device that containing the list of tests to run, and then specifying that file using `-e testFile`.
